quotes.quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: No pessimist ever discovered the secret of the stars or sailed an uncharted land, or opened a new doorway for the human spirit.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: In human life, art may arise from almost any activity, and once it does so, it is launched on a long road of exploration, invention, freedom to the limits of extravagance, interference to the point of frustration, finally discipline, controlling constant change and growth.
quotes.author: Susanne Langer

quotes.quote: We shall not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.
quotes.author: T. S. Eliot

quotes.quote: I'm of the mind that even people who have limitations, if they have a curiosity, they will find a way to explore it.
quotes.author: Tish Grier

quotes.quote: Emergencies have always been necessary to progress. It was darkness which produced the lamp. It was fog that produced the compass. It was hunger that drove us to exploration. And it took a depression to teach us the real value of a job.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo
